headline: It’s Up, but Puerto Rico’s Grid Is Crippled, Broke and Vulnerable
abstract: The lines and poles rebuilt after Hurricane Maria held up, but some power plants did not, leading to another worrying blackout.
lead_paragraph: SAN JUAN, P.R. — After the devastation of Hurricane Maria, the federal government set aside nearly $2 billion to fix the electrical transmission lines in Puerto Rico, hoping to avert another epic blackout. But when the next disaster arrived this week — the strongest earthquake in a century — the island was once again plunged into darkness.
